Issues.Title: Rounded Corners on Components
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

Hi, WinForms button has rounded corners, is it possible to have the same for GroupBox, Tabs and Panel's Borderlines?

### API Proposal


is it possible to have the same for GroupBox, Tabs and Panel's Borderlines?

### API Usage


UI improvement

### Alternative Designs

_No response_

### Risks

_No response_

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

VS Designer does not have to support this feature

Issues.Title: Small refactoring in CoreSwitches class
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- In the original `CoreSwitches` class there is a field, `s_perfTrack`, that is initialized the first time that the `PerfTrack` property is accessed. The problem is that this is not thread-safe. Moving the initialization of the property to the static constructor ensures that its initialization is made thread-safe at the runtime level, and that it's initialized only once.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- No direct customer impact

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Low

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

Issues.Title: Designer action panel line refactoring
Issues.Body:
Depends on #9367. Only the last commit is not in the quoted PR and should be reviewed here.

As dicussed [here](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9367#discussion_r1251266055), we're attempting a refactoring to limit the use of the `!` operator when annotating `DesignerActionPanel.Line` objects.

The idea is to stop creating `Line` objects early without initialising them and start creating then only when we are actually going to use them. To do si we change the `LineInfo` type to be a factory type.

Issues.Title: Moving the SplitContainer splitter size at runtime crashes the DemoConsole application.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, This is the new SplitContainer integration test added to the DemoConsole application.

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, the DemoConsole application crashes when moving the SplitContainer splitter size in .Net 8.0. But build and run the application in Release and Debug modes gives different results.

**Release mode：**

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/feef2f95-dd97-4f11-af12-3eb88433ac91

**Debug mode:**


https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/62268dd9-7457-4224-8e33-f5d50eefa4d8

**Call stack:**
System.StackOverflowException
  HResult=0x800703E9
  Message=Exception of type 'System.StackOverflowException' was thrown.


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo

### More Info

1. Resizing other controls or forms in the DemoConsole application also crashes.
2. Probably caused by the PR [9364](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9364)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving the SplitContainer splitter size at runtime crashes the DemoConsole application." (#9410)

Issues.Title: An exception popped up when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23330.16

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It also repro's in .NET 7.0.

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/4ae6cb77-9592-41ae-96df-65fe24d9241b

![menu-1](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/d9a6ef8a-76fc-4638-9ddd-8fa88128324f)

**Call Stack:**
System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Design
  StackTrace:
   at System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripMenuItemDesigner.InitializeDropDown() in C:\test\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\src\System\Windows\Forms\Design\ToolStripMenuItemDesigner.cs:line 1618


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An exception popped up when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application" (#9413)

Issues.Title: Failed to launch design tools server process process

### Environment

Version 17.6.4

### .NET version

net 6.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

I can't open forms since today. I did no update. I tried to reinstall Visual Studio Community but it did nothing.
See errors log in diagnostics

Issues.Title: Update control owning field of TextBox to using weak reference(#9224)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Related to #9224 


## Proposed changes

- Update the control owning field of TextBox  to using weak references
- Enable the GC collect test for the TextBox  control in unit test cases


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The strong reference used by the original Owner property can cause a memory leak

## Regression? 

-  No


<!-- end TELL-MODE -->



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Unit tests
 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- dotnet 8.0.0-preview.7.23328.11
